page.title: 07RELIGION
page.content: The Monklands District, including Townhead, has a very high percentage of Roman Catholics, the result of immigration from Ireland last century. One feature of the district that has persisted to the present day is hence religious bigotry, with Orange Walks and Hibernian marches, vandalism and graffiti ("IRA" and "UVF" and rude remarks about the Pope and so on ), fights between neighbouring schools, and a set of beliefs that each side holds about the other. For instance it is a widely held belief on the Protestant side that the reason for the pedestrianisation of Coatbridge Main Street was to prevent the July Orange Walk going past St. Patrick's R.C. church in it.
